title: Drawing, Design for Store Window in the Art Deco Style, ca. 1925
title_raw: Design for Store Window in the Art Deco Style
medium: Graphite, brush and white gouache, pen and gold ink on gray paperboard
markings: At lower right:  large [2 3/8  x 1 1/2 in.] shield-shaped stamp in blue [date in red]:  KILEMNICK E CIA/ 524 FLORIDA/ [date]/V. T. 31 [REC?] 3648.  This stamp is imprinted on top of (so it surrounds) the small [1/2 x 1 in.] copyright stamp in black: LEY  7092/9510/DE PROTECCION/ A LA/PROPIEDAD/ARTISTICA
description: Shop window above tall dado.  In middle of vitrine, a three-sided protruding platform with triangular display openings on either side.  In upper section, stepped marble panels with stepped glass or mirrored panels above.  In the central glass panel, a wrought iron or engraved glass rectangular panel with circle pattern.    Decorated panels on front of upper exterior of structure, as well as on left side of vitrine.  A gold band frames each of the large glass sections of the vitrine; a thin gold horizontal line also extends across the exterior base.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for Store Window in the Art Deco Style, ca. 1925. Graphite, brush and white gouache, pen and gold ink on gray paperboard. 
Gift of Maureen Cogan. 1999-39-12
